title: Is it just me or does it feel like "outplay" no longer applies to this game?
body: I mean I know I'm going to get downvoted into hell for this, but let us just be real here, I see at least one of {{champion:238}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:21}}{{champion:133}} in pretty much every game, they all build lethality and there isn't really an "outplay" potential. It feels more like haha oops you died guess you should've bought armor, oh wait just kidding you did! and I shredded through it anyway :^). Rip {{item:3157}}  and hello black and white simulator. Is it just me that feels this way? I cant say ive ever been "outplayed" by any of these champions. I just get steamrolled into a ggez.

replies.body:
It doesn't 

you don't have enough time to outplay anymore
a fight between a bruiser and an adc lasted 10 to 15 sec before

Renekton can legit combo you and kill you in 1 or 2 sec now

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Sona x Rubick,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UQd4O7VE,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-02-28T22:34:57.483+0000)

>

Ren should always do that, until late game where he shouldn't but still can.

he can still do it in late game


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kOc09vzfbJk

riot made it possible due to a ton of things since season 2
black cleaver 
damage creep
ect...

renekton used to build full tank and 0 offensive items, but now with all the nerfs since years to defense, all the buffs to offense he just go offense and 2 shots you

this shows why i'm fighting to get back season 2, where fights were longer, and you could outplay
Renek always opened brutalizer which would go into black cleaver then tank, similar to a lot of AD bruisers. Doesnt just hard tank
*Should* a fight between just two people last 15 seconds though?
IT should last at least five, so that kayle's ult does not last longer than the engagement.
Edge of night is the issue. As soon as an assassin gets it all the opponent's agency goes out the window.

I care about people making annoying threads on gameplay with no substance, as we apparently need an excuse to complain about Zed every waking moment despite Ahri maintaining a 53% win rate and 2nd-3rd highest play rate for mid for the last 2 years

My current experience of the game is everything explodes, as it has been for some time. I'm only playing normals every so often because it's been a boring shitshow since s5, and Riot killed Vlad outright

I used to have long winded discussions about balance and the general state, but there isn't really much point. Riot can do whatever they'd like, and the game is never going to be balanced. As soon as things start to level out or even stagnate, we get a new season with a whole new wave of balance problems

Ya dude, Ahri's so busted man. Obviously the only indicator of bustedness is win rate and pick rate. 

You're being hypocritical. You're spewing out the same dumbass stat that's been floating around boards about ahri as a response to every "x champ is busted", and not stating anything of substance about what makes her so "broken" or what needs to be addressed about her.

Don't reason with lb mains.  They don't actually realize their champion is perma banned in pro play, and high elo for a reason. Don't forget Zed is cancer because him being able to abuse a broken stat finally made him hit a 50% wr.  Xd boards, I love this place.

Personally, all ining someone at lv 3 with her is kinda disgusting, but in the same light, talon can do the same thing, except at lv 2. Not to mention, you and I both know high burst due to lethality is toxic. Annie, is a *burst* mage, oh look at that she is doing her job correctly. You build, mr against her and she hurts a lot less. *LETHALITY* on the other hand shreds through armor like it is a piece of paper not to mention there is specifically a 200 g more expensive item than zhonyas that has offensive/defensive stats with 1/4th the cooldown.

Also, that was season 5? This is season 7 lmao. And you are unranked currently. So you sound like those season 1 challengers, season 7 golds lul

A chain vest or seeker's will counter 9250g worth of Lethality items, and that's at level 18. They don't actually get 45 armor pen until then, so it's even worse. It's a very common misconception that building armor against penetration doesn't work, even if they're stacking Cleaver and LW on top of it (which doesn't matter for 90% of games)

Oh and by the way: A void staff with Sorcs vs 100 MR actually penetrates more than 3 Lethality items. 

Edge of Night has a lower cooldown because it can't be used reactively. You cannot decide "I do not want Zed to ult me" with the shield, you have to hope that is the ability that ends up wasted on it. It was overtuned by the buff and has been nerfed already, and AP mids never stopped being meta regardless

Gold Efficiency
Zhonya's Hourglass is 92.73% gold efficient without its active.

Gold Efficiency
In combat, Edge of Night is 93.31% gold efficient without its active effect. Out of combat, Edge of Night item.png Edge of Night is 101.05% gold efficient without its active effect.

They're almost identical in stat efficiency, both giving offensive/defensive stats, but Zhonya's active is significantly stronger when used correctly

And by the way, I'm still playing with diamonds even now. Just the other day I dumpstered a Master Lee 1v2 as a shitty meme hero, if this game was as fulfilling as Street Fighter I might care enough to get another shiny badge

He threw the factbook at em
https://media.giphy.com/media/Aff4ryYiacUO4/giphy.gif

Uh, no. Outplaying is still very much a part of this game.

"Outplaying" someone is defined by playing a situation better than your opponent to achieve a better result

Zed jumping on an isolated target and oneshotting them before they react is, indeed, not an "outplay". It's an assassin doing his job.

If that target flashes just right when Zed ults, dodging his spells, then stuns the Zed and bursts him, then the target "outplayed" Zed because the target was expected to die to Zed.

If Zed expects the flash, predicts the location with his Q, and finishes with a flash-E-AA, then Zed outplayed his target, because it was expected that Zed would fail to hit his target if they flashed out of the normal Q area.

For just those examples,

{{champion:238}} Dodge his Q. A well timed flash can cause you to leave Zed at your prior location when he ults, often causing him to miss his Q/E and negating a large amount of damage. Using hourglass obviously negates his ult, and if he ults in while your allies are waiting unbeknownst to him,  he very well may be fucked.
{{champion:120}} E has a weird interaction with flash that can let you get out of range. R can be dodged with mobility spells, especially at long range (compared to other initiation spells, Hec ult has a pretty slow travel time.)
{{champion:104}} autos can be bodyblocked by creeps, towers, and even your team mates. His R can be dodged and you get two chances to dodge his Q.
{{champion:21}} Don't stand behind low HP minions (duh) and take advantage of the fact that she can't fucking move during her ult. Fight her in areas without other targets she can hit to massively lower her dps. Stay in close range to be able to quickly and easily move out of her ult.
{{champion:133}} is a lane bully, and can dominate most melees in a 1v1. She can't do so well in a 1v2: fight dirty. Besides that, her Vault can be cancelled by displacements, her Q can be dodged, and she can be baited pretty easily.

Additionally, {{summoner:3}} {{summoner:21}} {{summoner:7}} can be tools to help against them.
{{item:3190}} {{item:3401}} {{item:3157}} are tools to deal with their burst.
{{item:3107}} can be used to stop a Quinn ult.
what? i have times where i get deleted in less than .4 seconds that is not enough time to react before you are dead

This is mostly why I like top lane. People are usually tankier, so it isn't so much about "dump everything the moment you can kill them" as it is playing around minions and wearing your opponent down through a few well-executed trades. Mistakes feel as severely punishing as when I'm playing mid, where one slip costs me 60% if not all of my health.
Hecarim, the most deadly lethality builder of them all.

What annoys me about Hec is that he can basically build Triforce, go full tank, and still do insane damage... and you can't stop him at all. No amount of cc will do it, since he's immune to it while he ults. And unless you end the game very quickly, he WILL get there.

And yes, you can burn flash for one of them. The next three, you have no flash and you lose If you're not a champ with mobility, of which there are many. There's no outplay chance there.

For the rest, yes there are ways to outplay, and some champions just shit all over them unless they're fed.
Not much outplay when a Varus can chunk any player thanks to lethality.
he's adc, this is what he was always supposed to do
adc's shouldn't chunk, they should melt.
Outplay's meaning sort of changed. Less about scrapping it out in prolonged bouts. More about setting up good bait or dodging/avoiding critical spells/traps.

Outplay to me means this:

"To best your opponent by predicting their movements/strategy or forcing them to make a mistake that you punish."

I.E baiting a zed into a 3v1 using a tri-bush.

You an't being outplayed, your just being run over.

of course there are other ways to outplay, my favorite is
"play {{champion:127}} and get a zhonya's, try to find the entire enemy team while alone and then when they catch you place ward and ult/zhonya's for five second invuln while the rest of your team collapse on the now moderately weaker enemy."
There is no outplay. There is just pressing buttons faster simulator 2017. You press buttons first? You win. Tactical and strategic game my ass.

Oh come on! Just because those champs can buy {{item:3814}} and then either {{item:3139}} or just build tank to become both inescapable and unstoppable doesn't mean they don't have outplay! You can TOTALLY do about 25% of their hp before they kill you and escape in less time than two turret shots
On Quinn I'll agree with you. Graves is dependent on the player behind him. The rest I haven't really had trouble with.

graves was pretty skill dependant, but I can confirm that he was busted last patch. I played him after not playing him since original rework and stomped. I don't even play marksman, and generally don't play burst characters either.

Well a lot of Graves 1 shot combo is dependent on him getting an auto reset, which a lot of low tier players don't even know is a thing. Obviously it becomes a problem higher up.
The game is now run by people who play only norms and go full ad wukong

I've recently been playing top lane more, generally Fiora & Gnar. I feel like top lane is the one lane that doesn't have people spamming lethality (which I absolutely HATE) aside from jayce. I haven't build it nor have the majority of my opponents and it feels great. The duels top feel much more rewarding and feel like they have more room for outplay potential.
i find darius is one of the few champions that can actually outplay people anymore
